requirements.summary: Build a single-page responsive portfolio layout matching the provided HTML structure and section IDs.
acceptanceCriteria: The app renders as a single-page layout with sections: Header, Navigation, Articles, Core Expertise, Career Overview, About, Footer.
Navigation links scroll to the corresponding section IDs (#articles, #expertise, #stats, #about).
All user-facing text content matches the provided HTML (name, tagline, section headings, article titles/descriptions/links, stats, footer copy).
Layout is responsive and usable on mobile (≤768px) and desktop.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page React layout that renders the required sections in order (Header, sticky Navigation, Articles, Core Expertise, Career Overview/Stats, About, Footer) and ensures the section containers use the correct IDs for in-page anchor navigation.
Create a page-level component that composes all portfolio sections into a single scrollable page (no multi-page routing).
Add static content/constants (all headings, article categories, cards, stats, about copy, footer text) to keep the portfolio fully frontend-only as required.
Update the document title to “ShiBhu - Thought Leadership Portfolio” to match the provided HTML.

requirements.summary: Implement the Header hero section with name, tagline, and five expertise tag pills styled per the provided design.
acceptanceCriteria: Header uses a dark gradient background and centered typography similar to the provided HTML design.
Expertise tags render as pill/badge UI elements and wrap on smaller screens.

file_operations.description: Implement the Header section using Tailwind styling (dark hero gradient, centered type) and render the five expertise tags as pill UI elements. Use shadcn/ui styling conventions (e.g., Badge component if available) for consistent pills; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the HeaderSection into the top of the single-page layout; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement a sticky top navigation bar with accessible hover/focus states and anchor scrolling to sections.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation remains visible at the top while scrolling (sticky).
Hover and focus states are visible and accessible.
Clicking a link scrolls to the correct section.

file_operations.description: Create a sticky top navigation bar with links to #articles, #expertise, #stats (Portfolio), and #about, styled as a light bar with accent hover/focus states; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add global styles to support smooth scrolling and anchor offset usability (e.g., scroll-behavior and section scroll-margin-top) to ensure nav links land correctly below the sticky bar.
Wire StickyNav directly below the Header and ensure all target sections exist with matching IDs; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement the Articles section with category groupings and responsive article-card grid including platform badge, date, and secure outbound links.
acceptanceCriteria: Each category heading is shown exactly as provided: “Global Capability Centers & Organizational Models”, “Marketplace Platforms & Ecosystem Strategy”, “Finance & Risk Management”, “Technology Leadership & Digital Transformation”, “Energy & Utilities Sector Strategy”.
Cards render in a responsive grid (one column on small screens; multiple columns on larger screens).
Each card includes the exact URLs provided and uses target="_blank" with appropriate rel attributes for security.
Hover interaction includes a subtle lift and shadow effect similar to the provided HTML.

file_operations.description: Implement the Articles section (#articles) that renders the required category headings and a responsive grid of article cards (title, platform badge, date, description, and outbound link opening in a new tab with appropriate rel attributes). Use shadcn/ui Card/Badge patterns if available for consistent cards/badges; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a reusable ArticleCard component with hover lift/shadow behavior, platform badge styling using the single accent color, and a clearly visible outbound link; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Populate the full article dataset (categories + cards) with exact titles/descriptions/platform/date/URLs from the provided HTML so the UI renders the correct content.
Wire ArticlesSection into the single-page layout in the correct order; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement the Core Expertise section as a responsive grid of expertise item cards with visual accents.
acceptanceCriteria: Expertise items render as cards/blocks with a clear visual accent (e.g., left border accent) consistent with the design system.
Grid responds gracefully from mobile to desktop.

file_operations.description: Implement the Core Expertise section (#expertise) as a responsive grid of expertise item cards/blocks with a clear accent (e.g., left border in the single accent color). Use shadcn/ui Card styling patterns if available; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add the provided Core Expertise titles and descriptions as static frontend content/constants.
Wire ExpertiseSection into the single-page layout; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement the Career Overview/Stats section with four stat cards in a responsive grid.
acceptanceCriteria: Stats render as uniform cards with a prominent number and a label.
Layout adapts to screen size (stacking on mobile).

file_operations.description: Implement the Career Overview section (#stats) rendering the four provided stats as uniform responsive cards with prominent numbers and labels. Use shadcn/ui Card patterns if available; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add the four stats values exactly as provided (700+ Published Articles, 50+ Publication Platforms, 9 Expertise Domains, 12 Years Experience).
Wire StatsSection into the single-page layout; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

acceptanceCriteria: About text matches exactly and remains readable on mobile and desktop (sensible max width, line height).

acceptanceCriteria: Footer renders with dark background and light text, centered.
Footer text matches exactly.

file_operations.description: Implement a Footer section with dark background and centered light text, rendering the exact provided copyright line and “Portfolio Last Updated: February 15, 2026”; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Establish a consistent Tailwind-based visual theme (single accent color) matching the provided HTML/CSS style across typography, spacing, and surfaces.
acceptanceCriteria: A single accent color is used consistently for highlights (e.g., section underline, platform badge, links).
Sections have consistent spacing and visual separation similar to the provided design (dividers/borders).
Typography hierarchy is clear (H1, section H2, category headings, card titles).

file_operations.description: Define global theme tokens and base styles consistent with the provided design (dark hero gradient support, off-white surfaces, light-gray section backgrounds, subtle borders, single accent color similar to #0066cc). Ensure no blue+purple dual theme is introduced.

Extend Tailwind theme as needed to support the portfolio design system (accent color, light-gray backgrounds, subtle borders/shadows, typography scale) while keeping a single accent color consistent across components.
Apply consistent section spacing, dividers/borders, and typography hierarchy classes across all sections to match the theme; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
